title: I WAS BANNED FOR SAYING DRAVEN. SINGLE WORD. THATS IT.
body:
I was banned for 2 weeks for saying Draven after pinging.

I am considered a reformed player.
I do not speak in game, and do not consider myself as toxic.

Riot, please respond and fix my situation

1. Screen cap of the ticket. :http://imgur.com/33ReEVU
2. Picture from my phone as a source of non photoshopped proof: http://imgur.com/zSkEJpa

But where's the hate speech, or death threats, or anything warranting punishment? All there is here is the typical dialogue you'll see by the very nature of this game. 

And not one comment is directed towards a summoner-- every one just names a champion. 

It's unreasonable to ask players in a competitive PvP team game to talk as if this were a Player vs. AI game. It just doesn't happen. 

And anyone who didn't want to hear his crap had the option to mute him, with no strategic downside because he was on the enemy team.

This community is full of pussies. They are words for crying out loud. When you go to football games do you see people cheering their rivals when theyre winning? No, they boo them because they are "toxic". Lol. You kids in this community keep trying to compare eSports to actual sports, but if a few little words hurt you then you will never be as big as real sports.

I'm a huge football fan, and have gone to 8+ games a year for the last 10 years of my life. I played 12 years of hockey when I was younger. I have a pretty good understanding of sportsmanship.

I can tell you for a fact, you would be escorted out by security if you start calling people %%%gots. Booing is one thing, person attacks are yet another. Certain things are accepted in society, and certain things are not. Just like certain things in League are tolerated. The last Rams home game, I saw a women get kicked out for refusing to sit so the children seated behind her could see.

If the enemy team gets a kill and you write 'boooo' in all-chat (or the ever popular 'you got lucky') ... people understand that. If the enemy team gets a kill and you type '%%%got' .. yeah, that's not going to fly.

It's very easy to compartmentalize what we consider acceptable online and in person. For some reason people think they can say anything they'd like online because they are behind a screen. I can guarantee you that if I walked up to you at a bar and started to read some of the chat logs you think are acceptable, you wouldn't receive it too well.

Hate speech aside, that little section where he basically says "I'm better than all you motherf*ckers" would have been enough for me to report him.  You should make a report category called "Rick James" for this sort of stuff.

"I'm one of the baddest motherf*ckers of all time, one of the best singers and one of the best looking motherf*ckers you've ever seen! ... Hold my drink bitch!"
